page.title: 19Local Dialect, Evesham
page.content:
"We 'ad ter goo ter the fewnerul uv the old mon's elder bruther Ern last wick. .....The service were at a church in a place near Brummajum wur they lived... I 'ad me a good croy,as I allers does at fewneruls even wen I don't no the carpse......." ********* ***********{TRANSLATION :}We had to go to the funeral of my husband's elder brother,Earnest,last week.The service was at a church in a place near Birm- ingham where they lived. I had a good cry , as I always do at funerals,even when I don't know the deceased.
(From an original article,printed in the 'Evesham Standard',September 8th 1984.Reproduced by kind permission of the Berrow's Newspapers Group.)
